newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee down despite denial of devaluation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee down despite denial of devaluation.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee opened 0.02 down in the kerb market at 39.30 to the dollar on Wednesday on rumours, officially denied, of a possible devaluation, dealers said.
One dealer said the rupee was likely to close lower on higher demand for the dollar from investors.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on August 29, was 35.6200/35.7981. An official at the bank denied that any rupee devaluation was planned.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates opened unchanged at 10.00 percent. -- Ibrahim Khan 9221-5685192
